intro: Solanum tuberosum var. sanmartinense, commonly known as the San Martín potato, is a variant of the common potato native to South America. It is characterized by its tuberous roots that are typically smaller and more elongated compared to standard potato varieties. The plant belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and produces flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are broad and lobed, typical of the genus Solanum. This variety is valued for its unique flavor and is often cultivated in specific regions of Peru.
